bcl:definition.bcl:text: compensation means a rate, remuneration, gain or reward of any kind paid, payable, promised, demanded, received or expected, directly or indirectly, and includes a promise or undertaking by a water utility to provide service as consideration for, or as part of, a proposal or contract to dispose of land or any interest in it;
comptroller means the person designated as the Comptroller of Water Rights under section 114 (1) of the Water Sustainability Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the use and accommodation provided, and a product or commodity furnished, by a water utility, and

the plant, equipment, apparatus, appliances, property and facilities employed by or in connection with a water utility in providing service or in furnishing a product or commodity for the purposes in which the water utility is engaged and for the use and accommodation of the public;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: tenant does not include a lessee for a term of more than 5 years;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person who owns or operates in British Columbia equipment or facilities for the diverting, developing, pumping, impounding, distributing or furnishing of water, for compensation,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to or for more than the prescribed number of persons or, if no number is prescribed, 5 or more persons, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the lessee, trustee, receiver or liquidator of a person referred to in paragraph (a),
a municipality in respect of services furnished by the municipality,
a person who furnishes services or commodity only to the person, the person's employees or tenants, if the service or commodity is not resold to or used by others,
the Greater Vancouver Water District under the Greater Vancouver Water District Act,
an improvement district as defined in section 1 (1) of the Water Sustainability Act,
a water users' community as defined in section 1 (1) of the Water Users' Communities Act,
a regional district under the Local Government Act in respect of the service of the supply of water

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in bulk to a municipality or electoral area participating in that service, or
to consumers in a municipality participating in that service,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person who supplies water by tanker truck,
a person who sells bottled water, or
a strata corporation, if the comptroller is satisfied that the owner developers within the meaning of the Strata Property Act have ceased to own a majority of the strata lots in the strata plan.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This Act applies only to water utilities that are subject to the legislative authority of British Columbia.

If a water utility furnishes a class of service in respect of which the water utility is not subject to the legislative authority of British Columbia, nothing in this section operates to make this Act inapplicable to the water utility in respect of another class of service furnished in respect of which the water utility is subject to the legislative authority of British Columbia.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A water utility is subject to the regulation and control of the comptroller.

The duties, responsibilities and restraints to which a water utility is subject are the same as are imposed on a public utility under the Utilities Commission Act and the powers and jurisdiction of the comptroller in respect of a water utility are the same as are vested in the British Columbia Utilities Commission under the Utilities Commission Act, in respect of a public utility, and for these purposes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the water utility is deemed to be a public utility, and

the Utilities Commission Act, other than sections 2.1 (b), (c) and (k) to (m), 28, 29, 44.1, 44.2, 45 (2), (3), (5) and (6), 58 (2.1) and (2.2) and 58.1, Part 3.1 and sections 125.1 and 125.2, applies.

bcl:section.bcl:text: If the comptroller determines that public convenience and necessity do not or will not require the construction or operation of a plant or system by a water utility, the comptroller may cancel the certificate of public convenience and necessity issued to the water utility for that plant or system.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section 41 of the Interpretation Act.
Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing a number for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of "water utility";
for the purpose of recovering the expenses arising out of the administration of this Act, prescribing fees, levies or other charges payable by water utilities and other persons;
exempting, or authorizing the comptroller to exempt, a water utility or other person, or a class of either of them, from the payment of a fee, levy or other charge.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Fees, levies and charges prescribed under this section may be different for different classes of water utility, different water utilities and different classes of persons.
